name: Alert
description: Component for alert messages with different types and themes. Provides accessible notification functionality for information, success, warning, and error messages.

type.description: Alert type determining the visual style and semantic meaning.

id.description: Unique identifier for the alert component.

props.title: Information
props.description: This is an informational message for users.

props.title: Success!
props.description: Your action has been completed successfully.

props.title: Warning
props.description: Please review this information before proceeding.

props.title: Error
props.description: An error occurred while processing your request.

props.title: Dark Theme Alert
props.description: This alert uses the dark theme variation.

when_to_use: Display system notifications and feedback messages
Show form validation results and errors
Communicate important information that requires user attention
Provide success confirmation for completed actions
Alert users to warnings or potential issues
when_not_to_use: For general content that doesn't require special attention
As a replacement for proper form validation inline messages
For decorative elements - use callouts or banners instead
When the message doesn't fit into standard alert categories
best_practices: Use appropriate alert types for the message context
Provide clear, actionable titles and descriptions
Position alerts where users expect to see them
Ensure sufficient color contrast for accessibility
Use consistent alert styling throughout the application
Consider screen reader users with proper ARIA attributes

accessibility.notes: Component provides proper ARIA live regions for dynamic alerts and semantic markup for different alert types.

variations: Alert types: Information, success, warning, error with distinct styling
Theme variations: Light and dark theme support
Content flexibility: Title and description slots
Icon integration: Automatic appropriate icons for each alert type

findings: Users expect consistent color coding for different alert types
Clear, concise alert messages improve user comprehension
Dismissible alerts give users control over their interface
Proper positioning improves alert visibility and effectiveness
Consistent alert styling helps users quickly understand message importance
